data.enText: a person who enters a building illegally in order to steal

ex.enText: The thief was caught in the act.

ex.chText: 我们的看门狗把小偷吓走了。
ex.enText: Our watchdog scared the thief away.
The thief was caught in the toils of the law.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，通常专指盗窃者，即常说的贼。

ex.chText: 帮匪过去常来骚扰这个村子。
ex.enText: This village used to be infested with bandits.

ex.chText: 她回家的路上，有一个蒙面强盗突然向她冲过去，抢走了她的全部东西。
ex.enText: On her way home, a masked bandit suddenly rushed to her and robbed her of all her possessions.

ex.chText: 歹徒对姑娘说，如果她动一下就把她杀死。
ex.enText: The bandit said he would kill the girl if she moved a muscle.

synonyms.bx: 指结帮成伙、出没于乡间或山林地区使用恐吓或暴力抢劫的人，现尤指袭击旅行者的歹徒。

ex.chText: 窃贼是从厨房的窗户潜入这所房子的。
ex.enText: The burglar got into the house through the kitchen window.

ex.chText: 夜贼破门而入，偷了我的钱。
ex.enText: The burglar broke in and stole my money.

ex.chText: 侦探很快就发现了窃贼的踪迹。
ex.enText: The detective soon got on the trail of the burglar.

synonyms.bx: 指入夜后破门或撬窗行窃的人。

ex.chText: 公交车上穿灰衣服的那个人是个三只手。
ex.enText: The man in grey on the bus is a pickpocket.

ex.chText: 扒手在地铁里偷走了我的钱包。
ex.enText: The pickpocket stole my purse in the subway.

synonyms.bx: 尤指在人多拥挤之处从人们口袋、手提包里偷东西的小偷。

ex.chText: 那强盗用枪逼着她打开保险箱。
ex.enText: The robber made her open the safe at gunpoint.
The robber is wanted by the police.

ex.chText: 强盗们打死了那个人并拿走了他的钱。
ex.enText: The robbers killed the man and took his money.

synonyms.bx: 多指用暴力、威胁等手段强行抢夺他人财物的人。

tr: a thief who enters a building with intent to steal

value.def: A burglar is a thief who enters a house or other building by force.

trans: 防盗系统；防盗报警系统；防盗警报系统；防盗铃系统；系统防盗铃
